snippet: The 10,000 civilian casualties reported by the United Nations, a record since it began its tallies in 2009, reflects the altered nature of a war in which almost no Western troops are still fighting.
abstract: United Nations says 2014 was deadliest year for civilians in Afghanistan since records started being kept in 2009, with deaths up 22 percent, to over 10,000, compared to same period in 2013; grim toll of Afghanistan's war reflects absence of American troops and increase in face-to-face conflicts between militants and Afghan forces.
lead_paragraph: The 10,000 civilian casualties reported by the United Nations, a record since it began its tallies in 2009, reflects the altered nature of a war in which almost no Western troops are still fighting.

headline.main: Civilian Toll in Afghan War Rose in 2014, U.N. Reports
headline.print_headline: Civilian Toll in Afghan War Rose in 2014, U.N. Reports
